p: Dengue virus transmission is influenced by several factors, including climate change [ 7], the global trade, human population dynamics, and international travel, that facilitate the spread of the vectors and introduction of the DENV into new areas [ 8, 9, 10, 11, 12]. Unplanned urbanization and high human population density play a major role in the DENV transmission and outbreaks [ 13, 14, 15].
